t: Psalm 25
Prayer for Protection, Guidance and Pardon.
A Psalm of David.
To*pn You, O Lord,*s I lift up my soul.
O*ln my God, in You I trust, Do*ln not let me be ashamed; Do*ln not let my enemies exult over me.
Indeed,*ln none of those who wait for You will be ashamed; Those*ln who deal treacherously without cause will be ashamed.
Make*ln me know Your ways, O Lord;*s Teach*ln me Your paths.
Lead*ln me in Your truth and teach me, For*ln You are the God of my salvation; For*ln You I wait all the day.
Remember,*ln O Lord,*s Your compassion and Your lovingkindnesses, For*ln they have been from of old.
Do*ln not remember the sins of my youth or my transgressions; According*ln to Your lovingkindness remember me, For*ln Your goodness’ sake, O Lord.*s
Good*ln and upright is the Lord;*s Therefore*ln He instructs sinners in the way.
He*ln leads the humble in justice, And*ln He teaches the humble His way.
All*ln the paths of the Lord*s are lovingkindness and truth To*ln those who keep His covenant and His testimonies.
For*ln Your name’s sake, O Lord,*s Pardon*ln my iniquity, for it is great.
Who*ln is the man who fears the Lord?*s He*ln will instruct him in the way he should choose.
His*ln soul will abide in prosperity, And*ln his descendants will inherit the land.
The*ln secret of the Lord*s is for those who fear Him, And*ln He will make them know His covenant.
My*ln eyes are continually toward the Lord,*s For*ln He will pluck my feet out of the net.
Turn*ln to me and be gracious to me, For*ln I am lonely and afflicted.
The*ln troubles of my heart are enlarged; Bring*ln me out of my distresses.
Look*ln upon my affliction and my trouble, And*ln forgive all my sins.
Look*ln upon my enemies, for they are many, And*ln they hate me with violent hatred.
Guard*ln my soul and deliver me; Do*ln not let me be ashamed, for I take refuge in You.
Let*ln integrity and uprightness preserve me, For*ln I wait for You.
Redeem*ln Israel, O God, Out*ln of all his troubles.
